He is a theoretical physicist and cosmologist who has proposed a number of unorthodox ideas and theories, such as a new model of the structure of the atom and a theory of a unified field that unifies general relativity and quantum mechanics. Nassim Haramein has proposed a number of unorthodox ideas and theories in the fields of physics and cosmology. Some of his main ideas and theories include:

* A new model of the structure of the atom, in which the proton is not a point particle, but rather a complex structure that includes a central black hole.
* A theory of a unified field that unifies general relativity and quantum mechanics, based on the idea that the vacuum of space is a complex, dynamic medium that can support a variety of physical phenomena.
* A theory of gravity that replaces the traditional inverse-square law with a new, hyperbolic law, which he claims can explain a number of phenomena that are difficult to understand using conventional physics, such as the behavior of black holes and the accelerating expansion of the universe.
* A theory of the origin of the universe based on a fractal, self-organizing process.

It's worth noting that many of his ideas and theories have not been widely accepted or supported by the scientific community, and some have been met with considerable skepticism.

Books:
